statement.p: Explain why the vectors \left[\begin{array}{r} -5 \\ -3 \\ 3 \\ 4 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} -3 \\ -3 \\ -1 \\ -2 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} -1 \\ 3 \\ 9 \\ 14 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} 22 \\ 6 \\ -30 \\ -44 \end{array}\right] , \text{ and } \left[\begin{array}{r} -1 \\ -1 \\ 3 \\ 1 \end{array}\right] span or don't span \mathbb{R}^4.

answer.p: The vectors \left[\begin{array}{r} -5 \\ -3 \\ 3 \\ 4 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} -3 \\ -3 \\ -1 \\ -2 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} -1 \\ 3 \\ 9 \\ 14 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} 22 \\ 6 \\ -30 \\ -44 \end{array}\right] , \text{ and } \left[\begin{array}{r} -1 \\ -1 \\ 3 \\ 1 \end{array}\right] do not span \mathbb{R}^4.
